name: Fota Island Resort

reviews.text: Myself, my partner and our 20 months old daughter stayed in Fota Island Resort on Sunday night of October bank holiday week end. It was a last minute decision to go away for 1 night so we only booked the hotel on Saturday but we managed to get a very good deal.
reviews.title: Wish we could ve stayed longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I loved the hotel and wished we could ve stayed longer. And we are definitely going to be back soon!
reviews.title: Enjoyable!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is very good, a short drive to/from Cork. We wanted to attend some of the live jazz gigs that week end and we found it easy to commute to and from Cork.
reviews.title: liz o r

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I loved everything about this hotel: lovely reception area, attentive and very professional staff, great dinner in the evening and a fabulous breakfast in the morning! Our room was very spacious, quiet and bathroom was amazing, with walk-in shower and deep bath with one of those waterfall type taps. Toiletries provided were of the high quality.
reviews.title: Great Couples Break!

reviews.text: I didnt use the spa as we had too much planned for our short stay there but I so wish I did, and next time I will.
reviews.title: Very enjoyable stay.

reviews.text: I attended a conference that was held at the gorgeous Fota Island Resort in July. It is a lovely modern hotel with all the luxury amenities that you could want.
reviews.title: Great Service at a lovely Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is located in the lush green Irish countryside about 20 minutes or so from downtown Cork. The only disadvantage to staying here is that it is not particularly convenient for sightseeing if you didn't have a car. (It cost about 25 euros to get by cab to the city center where went to pick up tours.) Other than that, it was a perfect place to stay. I didn't have a chance to take advantage of the golf course or the spa, but both looked wonderful!
reviews.title: disapointing for a 5 star hotel

reviews.text: The rooms were very comfortable. Nice cushy beds with soft pillows. (The duvets were very warm, I wished the beds had also had a bed sheet so you had a cooler covering.) There were lots of outlets into which we could plug all our techy gadgets!
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Great Location

reviews.text: I loved the bathroom, especially the walk in shower with rain shower head. There were nice toiletries, fluffy towels and robes.
reviews.title: Terrible service and weak messages!

reviews.text: The morning breakfast buffet was spectacular! Lots of wonderful pastries, smoked salmon, eggs, cereals, and really good sausages. The best part of breakfast, however, was when we discovered we could also order off the menu. The waffles were the best I have ever had - real Belgian waffles with little crunchy bits of sugar.
reviews.title: Great hotel even though away from city

reviews.text: We have just returned from our stay in Foto Island Hotel. From the moment we entered the lobby we relaxed. A girl named Sabina on reception was unbelievably lovely and helpful a real treasure!
reviews.title: What a wonderful stay

reviews.text: Our room was fab spacious and comfortable and what a great bathroom! Just great. The pool was great but the kiddies pool was not in use last night. We ate in the Amber Lounge last night and again the food lovely and staff very attentive. Breakfast - where do I begin fresh orange juice, watermelon kiwi strawberries raspberries pineapple blackberries all beautifully fresh. Any bread you could possibly want. Hot food bacon eggs hash browns pudding tomato mushroom. Cereals what ever you want! one of the waitress Cherry was her name was so lovely and she got pancakes for my daughters, so yummy. Again Cherry was so lovely like a ray on sunshine bright smile and so very pleasant. All the staff were so lovely and very attentive. Would go back again in the morning!
reviews.title: Perfect family retreat

reviews.text: We booked a family break over halloween in Fota Island and everything was just perfect. As a family of five we always have issues with hotels catering for four but they couldn't be more helpful in arranging interconnecting rooms for us with three single beds in one room and a double in the other. I actually think that all five of us could have slept in the double bed !
reviews.title: family vacation

reviews.text: With three growing girls (7,11,13) the bathroom was a big hit with plenty of space, separate shower and bath and towels for all. One minor (and I mean minor) issue was that there were only two bathrobes but the youngest was just has happy wrapped in a big towel.
reviews.title: Perfect every time

reviews.text: We used the pool as a family which was great, there is no shallow end so not really suited to kids who cant swim and just want to splash around. In saying that there are sufficient flotation devices around for trainee swimmers to use.
reviews.title: Perfect Family getaway

reviews.text: Rented on of d lodges for d weekend. It was like a home from home. We loved it. Had every modern convenience. Kids loved d playground close by and overall it was lovely and relaxing. We ate in d hotel bar for our main meals, the food was just okay, thought it could have been better, but d staff were fantastic and very attentive.the only draw back of d hotel facilities was we have small kids and d pool is not open to them during d hours of the day that we would use it so found ourselves rushing to get into it before "adult only time".
reviews.title: Courtside lodges

reviews.text: We are a family with a small baby and a teenager. Stayed for 4 nights in October 2012.
reviews.title: Spa, the wildlife park and the bathroom

reviews.text: Few excellent points:
reviews.title: Sheer luxury!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bathrooms in the rooms are just great
reviews.title: 'Wow'

reviews.text: Spa is excellent. If you go ask for Kasia, she is really really good, also explains everything and gives good ideas (well I found it helpful for getting back in shape after birth)
reviews.title: Good food and hard working staff

description: Fota Island Hotel & Spa is one of Ireland’s finest five star resort properties. Just 15 minutes from Cork City Centre, 20 minutes from Cork International Airport and 2 hours from Dublin, it offers 131 bedrooms and suites overlooking the surrounding 800 acres of woodland and championship-standard golf courses. Tennis, running trails and a world class spa - with 18 treatment rooms, swimming pool, hydrotherapy suite and 24-hour fitness room - are just some of the many leisure facilities available.
